abstract.text: An anchor that tracks the position and orientation of an App Clip Code in the physical environment.

inlineContent.text: Your App Clip gives users immediate access to critical or context-specific parts of your app’s AR experience, and makes it easy for them to download and launch your full app if they choose.

You can use physical App Clip Codes in the real world to enable users to discover your App Clip. An App Clip Code includes a unique URL and can incorporate an NFC tag. When users hold their iPhone near the code or scan it with the camera or Code Scanner in Control Center, the system offers to launch the code’s associated App Clip.
For more on App Clip Codes, see
. For an app that reacts to App Clip Codes in AR, see
There may be multiple App Clip Codes visible in the camera feed that share the same
, so ARKit also relies on the App Clip Code’s location (see
) to distinguish different App Clip Codes in the physical environment.

abstract.text: Integrate hardware sensing features to produce augmented reality apps and games.
An object that specifies the position and orientation of an item in the physical environment.
A matrix encoding the position, orientation, and scale of the anchor relative to the world coordinate space of the AR session the anchor is placed in.
Support for custom anchor subclasses.
An anchor that tracks the position and orientation of an App Clip Code in the physical environment.
The states in the process of decoding an App Clip code URL.
The App Clip Code’s radius in meters.
The URL encoded in an App Clip Code.
A state that indicates the process of decoding an App Clip Code URL.
Tells the delegate that one or more anchors have been added to the session.
Tells the delegate that one or more anchors have been removed from the session.
Tells the delegate that the session has adjusted the properties of one or more anchors.
An interface for objects that track the location of real-world objects or locations.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the object’s transform is valid.
Provide people a shortcut to selected content and features of your app.
Display content and provide services in an AR experience with App Clip Codes.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Interacting with App Clip Codes in AR

abstract.text: A false value.
A true value.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
